ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
What is your overall rating of the primary instructor?
The primary instructor's sensitivity to students and ability to provide students with adequate feedback was:

narratives.question_text: Indicate the total number of hours per week (outside the classroom) you spent on this course:
comments: 6h
1h
4-5 hours per week
8 hours
4 hours

narratives.question_text: Looking back on this course, what is your overall assessment of the course:  What are its strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might it be improved?
comments: Readings were great and very useful to my future work. I plan to save the syllabus for eternity. I hated the scheduling of the lab on Friday afternoons. Forestry students generally don't have classes on Fridays, so I think that Friday labs might discourage their enrollment, if that matters. The taking of attendance felt not great. I'm more pro people doing what they need to learn, not being forced to come to class if it's not useful.
good
Great to know about methodologies of exposure assessment But can be more specific for more fields instead of some common strategies

I might like more in depth assignments that includes much more time and focus on the specifics of exposure measurements and techniques. This would include the types of instruments to use in different situations, how to use them, and the appropriateness of each. I know we covered this briefly in class, but I think it might be useful to go a little more in depth. I would also like to see more hands on work in general. Move it from a full lecture to more opportunities for student engagement.
Course provided a good overview of exposure assessment as it relates to occupational and environmental epidemiology.
This course provides a good overview of exposure assessment methods.

I thought this course did a great job of covering the breadth of the field of exposure science while still covering important subjects in sufficient depth. I am not sure that the Friday discussion section contributed significantly to the course, as it often felt rushed and too short.
Very practical, up to date, evidence-based.
This was a good course.
The lectures were very holistic, but often dry. I don't think that this can really be improved in any way though, due to the nature of the course.
Good overview of important topics in exposure science. Including the industrial hygienist and hands-on labs was a major strength of this course.
Great

Excellent course. Could be improved by having more applied exposure assessment opportunities. For example, an exposure assessment case study over the course of the semester, where we assess a situation in multiple ways could be a good way to integrate skills.

narratives.question_text: Please evaluate the instructor of this course. What are the instructor's strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might his or her teaching be improved?
comments: Instructor: Nicole Deziel  Please give her tenure yesterday. She designed a great course and was quite fair. I've heard that it much improved on the version Leaderer taught.
Instructor: Nicole Deziel  good
Instructor: Nicole Deziel  Very nice and professional
Instructor: Nicole Deziel  Dr. Deziel was very personable and friendly. She always made it well known when she was available to meet with students and her office hours were at a great time.

Instructor: Nicole Deziel  Dr. Deziel is very committed to the course, and shares a lot of her own research experience (which is helpful to learn some of the common pitfalls when you are designing a study that involves exposure measurements.

Instructor: Nicole Deziel  Dr. Deziel is very knowledgeable about exposure methodology and is always willing to answer student questions. Her own experience with exposure assessment was very helpful for the course.
Instructor: Nicole Deziel  She is great!

Instructor: Nicole Deziel  Dr. Deziel is a very knowledgeable and engaging lecturer. She is very invested in the success of her students, and she is always willing to meet with students who are struggling.
Instructor: Nicole Deziel  Excellent. Approachable and willing to teach.
Instructor: Nicole Deziel  Nicole is excellent.
Instructor: Nicole Deziel  Dr. Deziel was wonderful and very articulate. I do wish that we could have received more in-depth feedback on the assignments, though.
Instructor: Nicole Deziel  Very knowledgeable on these topics and offered good feedback during office hours. Overall a good teacher but at times seemed unsure of herself.
Instructor: Nicole Deziel  Great teacher, clear, patient with explanations, very knowledgeable.

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize this course for a fellow student? Would you recommend it to another student? Why or why not?
comments: I would recommend it to others and have. I know a lot more about exposure assessment than I did before.
I would recommend
Great class about occupational exposure assessment

If you are going to be working in a field where you are either designing or critically reading studies that involve exposure measurement, than this course will provide some background. If you will not be working with these things, then it would not likely be relevant to you.
I would recommend this course for students interested in an introduction to exposure assessment methodology.

This course is a great introduction into the field of exposure science and the methods you might apply to exposure science research. I would recommend this course to those who are new to the field as well as those who have some experience with exposure science, as Dr. Deziel's expertise means that even experienced students will learn something new.
Excellent. Highly recommend.
This was a great course.
Yes! Great introduction to exposure sciences if you are interested.
Good course to learn about the basics of occupational and exposure science. I recommend taking this course.
Yes, it's important for EHS learning.
Highly recommended. The best EHS course I've taken.
